TEXT: e1: Due to the increase in opening hours on Sundays and holidays there is a rise in employment.
CN RELATION: increase in opening hours on Sundays and holidays, rise in employment (Causes)/opening hours on Sundays and holidays, increased (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e2: However it's mainly temps (that is, students, pupils etc.) who are employed,
CN RELATION: students, temps (PartOf)/students, temps (IsA)/pupils, temps (PartOf)/pupils, temps (IsA)/temps, employed (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e3: so this has hardly any effect on the level of full-time employment and the number of unemployed.
CN RELATION: employment of temps, effect on level of full-time employment (NotHasA)/increase in opening hours, effect on the level of full-time employment (NotHasA)/increase in opening hours, effect on the number of unemployed (NotHasA)/employment of temps, effect on level of full-time employment (NotCauses)/increase in opening hours, effect on the level of full-time employment (NotCauses)/increase in opening hours, effect on the number of unemployed (NotCauses)

TEXT: e4: On top of that, private and family life suffers massively because of this reduction and shifting in designated off-times.

TEXT: e5: And it's only the large companies that can afford the additional personnel expenditure.

TEXT: e6: For these reasons supermarkets and shopping centres should not be allowed to be open for business on arbitrary Sundays and holidays.
